page.title: 13Birdlife Around Nantwich.
page.content: The land,streams and river in the area encourage an abundance of{bird {life}found throughout the year.The summer brings its swallows, moose and sand martins and swifts, all of which breed in the area.The river attracts the cormorants, kingfisher, sandpipers to its sandy banks and the lesser white throat has been seen in the leafy lanes.The kestral and sparrow hawk hover above their prey by day whilst dusk brings out the tawny owl, barn owl and little owl.{Reptiles}and amphibians are not that easy to find. Farmers are draining ponds and low lying damp areas thus reducing the breeding places however frog, toad and newts are still to be found breeding and the crested newt is still to be found in the vicinity of the local agricultural college, and the grass snake is the only reptile sited.
